aspect: - Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.
- Muto would be Chelsea's first Japanese player if he moves to west London.
- Muto has scored 11 goals for Japan since signing his first professional contract in 2014.
- Muto has a shot at joining Chelsea after receiving an offer from the club.
- Muto's fine form continues during the current campaign, helping his club to third place in the division.
- Chelsea are considering a two-week pre-season tour of Japan this summer.
explain: The key fact in this aspect is that Chelsea have made an offer for Yoshinori Muto, a Japanese forward who currently plays for FC Tokyo. It is reported that Muto will join Chelsea's Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. Additionally, Muto has claimed that Chelsea's interest in him is not connected to the £200 million deal they signed with Yokohama Rubber in February.
The aspect highlights that if Yoshinori Muto moves to Chelsea from FC Tokyo, he would become their first Japanese player.
The aspect highlights that Muto, who has just joined Chelsea on loan from FC Tokyo, has scored 11 goals for Japan since 2014.
Muto could potentially move to Chelsea, in light of the offer made to him by the club.
The aspect describes Muto's fine form during the current campaign, despite his move to Chelsea not being directly related to a recent #200million deal between the club and Yokohama Rubber.

Chelsea is considering a two-week pre-season tour of Japan this summer, which would be a good opportunity for the team to bond and prepare for the upcoming season. Additionally, it would also provide a chance to introduce the team to the Japanese fans and to promote the club in the country.
